channel.title: My AutoResponder
channel.description:
I'm currently putting together a nice autoresponder. One problem.
If someone says the word "Hi" to me, I will respond with one of three phrases, either hello, sup, or whats up.
But let's say I have one of my replies the same as one of the phrases that someone can ask, there's a chance I'll reply to one of my own answers!
My question is if there's a way around this. I have no idea what to look for, I just want to fix it before it's a problem.
Please write,
Mike.

item.title: My AutoResponder
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

There’s much easier ways. I’ll post a tutorial on it later.

Read full topic

item.title: My AutoResponder
item.dc:creator: @junkj junkj
item.description:
@junkj wrote:

[quote=“The Un-Named, post:2, topic:59948”]//By Fawki!, edited verses *aka WT-Fakawi, Fakawi, Fawki procedure Respond; //PotatoeResponder. var TheResponce : String; begin OldLine := TheLine; TheName := lowercase(trim(GetTextAtEx(20, 415, 45, SmallChars, False, False, 0, 2, 0, 40, True, tr_NormalChars))); TheLine := lowercase(trim(GetTextAtEx(20, 415, 45, SmallChars, False, False, 0, 2, 16711680, 40, False, tr_NormalChars))); NewLine := TheLine; if(OldLine <> NewLine)then if(pos('yo', TheName) <> 0) or (pos(Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick, TheName) <> 0) then begin end else begin WriteFileString(TheFile,TheTime+' '+ TheName + '' + TheLine + chr(13)); if(inChat2('woodc')) or (inChat2('wc')) and (inChat2('lvl')) or (inChat2('lev')) then begin TheResponce := IntToStr(GetSkillLevel('woodcutting')); SendText(TheResponce + ' ' + TheName) GameTab(4); end; if(inChat2('drop')) or (inChat2('wat')) or (inChat2('doin'))then begin TheResponce := TreeReply[random(5)]; SendText(TheResponce); end; if(inChat2('lol')) or (inChat2('lmao')) or (InChat2('rofl'))then begin TheResponce:= TreeReply[random(5)+ 6]; SendText(TheResponce + ' '+TheName); end; if(inChat2(Players[CurrentPlayer].Name)) or (InChat2(Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick))then begin TheResponce:= TreeReply[random(6)+ 12]; SendText(TheResponce +' '+TheName); end; if(inChat2('hi')) or (inChat('hello')) or (inChat('hey'))then begin TheResponce:= TreeReply[random(6) + 19] SendText(TheResponce); end; end; end;

Use something like that.[/quote]

Isnt there a easier way like…
case of random 3:
Or something like that?
If there is can you show me how,i never used that thing.

Read full topic

item.title: My AutoResponder
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

//By Fawki!, edited verses *aka WT-Fakawi, Fakawi, Fawki procedure Respond; //PotatoeResponder. var TheResponce : String; begin OldLine := TheLine; TheName := lowercase(trim(GetTextAtEx(20, 415, 45, SmallChars, False, False, 0, 2, 0, 40, True, tr_NormalChars))); TheLine := lowercase(trim(GetTextAtEx(20, 415, 45, SmallChars, False, False, 0, 2, 16711680, 40, False, tr_NormalChars))); NewLine := TheLine; if(OldLine <> NewLine)then if(pos('yo', TheName) <> 0) or (pos(Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick, TheName) <> 0) then begin end else begin WriteFileString(TheFile,TheTime+' '+ TheName + '' + TheLine + chr(13)); if(inChat2('woodc')) or (inChat2('wc')) and (inChat2('lvl')) or (inChat2('lev')) then begin TheResponce := IntToStr(GetSkillLevel('woodcutting')); SendText(TheResponce + ' ' + TheName) GameTab(4); end; if(inChat2('drop')) or (inChat2('wat')) or (inChat2('doin'))then begin TheResponce := TreeReply[random(5)]; SendText(TheResponce); end; if(inChat2('lol')) or (inChat2('lmao')) or (InChat2('rofl'))then begin TheResponce:= TreeReply[random(5)+ 6]; SendText(TheResponce + ' '+TheName); end; if(inChat2(Players[CurrentPlayer].Name)) or (InChat2(Players[CurrentPlayer].Nick))then begin TheResponce:= TreeReply[random(6)+ 12]; SendText(TheResponce +' '+TheName); end; if(inChat2('hi')) or (inChat('hello')) or (inChat('hey'))then begin TheResponce:= TreeReply[random(6) + 19] SendText(TheResponce); end; end; end;

Use something like that.

item.title: My AutoResponder

item.description:

If someone says the word “Hi” to me, I will respond with one of three phrases, either hello, sup, or whats up.
